text:
- My team is responsible for
the security of the AWS Cloud
across the entire company.
The biggest challenge was ensuring
that all AWS accounts across the company
had the same level of appropriate security
and compliance settings.
We also aim to reduce risk

by monitoring the status
of all AWS accounts
and detecting inappropriate configurations
at the earliest stage possible.
We were already using AWS Security Hub

to aggregate finding
from Amazon GuardDuty,

and we utilized the
Amazon OpenSearch Service
to develop a SIEM,

enabling us to scale
our security operations
independently of our team's skills.

Amazon Security Lake automatically
centralized security data
from AWS environments, SaaS providers,
on-premises and cloud sources

into a purpose-built data lake
stored in our AWS account.
It allows us to quickly implement
advanced security operations

such as compliance
monitoring and reporting
that do not rely on subscales.
With OCSF support,

Security Lake makes it
possible to normalize

and aggregate security data
from various non-AWS sources.

I strongly believe that we
can create an environment

for advanced analytics in
conjunction with other services

without worrying about
increasing log volume
as our business grows.
By building on AWS,
our business operates in a secure
and fast environment,

allowing us to focus on
serving our customers.
(upbeat music)
